metadata.title: The Computational Boundary of a “Self”: Developmental Bioelectricity Drives Multicellularity and Scale-Free Cognition

missing_segments: The PDF includes publication information (journal, date, volume, article number, DOI) and author information (affiliation, ORCID) that are missing from the consensus text.
The figure captions for Figure 1 and Figure 2, as well as the figures themselves, are absent in the consensus text.
The keywords listed at the end of the abstract ('development, bioelectricity, gap junctions, primitive cognition, active inference') are not present in the consensus.
The 'Summary of key ideas of Scale-Free Cognition' box from the PDF is missing from the consensus.
The funding and acknowledgment sections, along with the conflict of interest statement, are not included in the consensus text.
The discussion section 'WHAT DOES IT FEEL LIKE TO BE A PANCREAS?', and the predictions and research program are also missing.
The reference list is missing from the consensus text.

metadata.title: The Bioelectrics of Immortality and Mortality in Cold-Sensitive Hydra oligactis

missing_segments: Missing detailed description of Dyeing and imaging the hydra from the Methods section.
Missing Image analysis section describing steps using ImageJ and provided supplementary data files.
Missing details about the image analysis performed in  'Image analysis of the VF2.0.Cl-dyed versus VF2.1.Cl-dyed versus FluoVolt-dyed hydra' from the Methods section.

The Results section is missing substantial content including specific findings related to dye toxicity, observations of ovaries/testes,  details on membrane voltage differences, specific p-values from statistical tests, and details about the variability observed in the replicates.

The Discussion section is missing several important paragraphs discussing topics such as prior efforts in bioelectric mapping, limitations of the data, discussion of dye toxicity, variability across animals, relationship between polarization level and aging in different organisms, and directions for future research including specific questions about ion channels, cell groups, and the association between aging-related physiologies and bioelectric patterns.
Missing Supplementary Material references.

Life its origin and its distribution.original_filename: Life  its origin  and its distribution  a perspective from the Conway-Kochen Theorem and the Free Energy Principle.pdf

metadata.title: Life, its origin, and its distribution: a perspective from the Conway-Kochen Theorem and the Free Energy Principle

text_extraction.text_file: /Users/mbstarr/Programs/michael-levin-qa-engine/outputs/extracted_texts/Life  its origin  and its distribution  a perspective from the Conway-Kochen Theorem and the Free Energy Principle.txt
text_extraction.detailed_passes_dir: /Users/mbstarr/Programs/michael-levin-qa-engine/outputs/extracted_texts/Life  its origin  and its distribution  a perspective from the Conway-Kochen Theorem and the Free Energy Principle

missing_segments: Missing Figure 1 which describes the interaction and causality in special relativity relevant to the CK theorem.
Missing Figure 2 which shows the decomposition of an isolated system U into components S and E, along with their interactions and boundaries, as relevant to the FEP.

The detailed explanation of the FEP framework, including the discussion of Markov Blankets and holographic screens in distinguishing systems from environments, and the role of Hamiltonian operators H_SE, H_S, and H_E, is missing or significantly condensed.

The discussion of specific examples challenging the definition of life, such as organic-chemistry-based systems (DNA, proteins, viruses) and the dependence of organisms on their environment, is missing.
The discussion of the Earth as a complex cognitive system ('Life as we know it' and Gaia) and the challenges of communicating with such a system is absent.
The explanation of a physical system as an information processor with multiple possible interpretations, leading to scale- and description-dependent causal emergence, is missing.
The nuanced discussion on the probability of recognizing extraterrestrial signals (P(r|s)) and the implications for the Drake equation and the Fermi paradox is simplified.
The concluding paragraph discussing the practical replacement of the OOL problem with recognizing and interacting with diverse intelligences is significantly shortened.
Author contributions, Funding information, Data availability statement and ORCID are missing.

metadata.title: The collective intelligence of evolution and development

missing_segments: The figure (Figure 1) illustrating the perspectives on individual and collective intelligence is missing.
The entire table (Table 1) discussing the relationships needed to turn a society into an individual, along with its associated text, is missing.
The Appendix section, including Box 1 about the Hopfield network and Figure A1 illustrating its architecture, is missing.
